text: We see a LITTLE GIRL dancing around in a grainy super 8 h movie. A LITTLE BOY wearing a monster MASK enters the fra He struggles to lift a double barrel shotgun. He points i at the girl and pretends to SHOOT.
(whispering slowly) Once I had a cat, he was the sweetest  little guy. Then one day he got sick  and died. My heart was broken. My  whole body hurt.
She continues dancing. The little boy imitates her.
After that, I saw things differently,  everything could be summed up with  three simple words... fuck the world.
The camera swings over to some ugly, toothless relations  watching the show. They laugh.
We open on a dark, lonely stretch of two lane blacktop. Off to the side of the road we see a rundown gas station.

Hey, welcome back to 93.5 WJRC's  Halloween monster weekend. I'm Jimmy  Ray and I'll be bringing you the  oldies, the goldies and sometimes  the moldies. The good, the bad and  the uglies straight from the WJRC  vaults.
A weathered wooden sign proclaims CAPTAIN SPAULDING'S WOR OF MONSTERS AND MADMEN, sits atop the building. A smaller sign below reads FRIED CHICKEN AND GASOLINE.

Hey, kids still trying to decide on  the right costume? Well why not head  on down to Randall's Penny Save  located on Kimball Rd. just off route  1 in Mackin County. Choose from a  wide array of ghosts and ghouls,  jeepers and creepers... (scary sound effects) ...everything you need for your  Halloween needs.
SHERIFF HUSTON, a tall southern good old boy, leans again his dusty cruiser smoking a cigarette, pumping gas into h tank.

Inside is a poorman's Ripley's Believe It or Not. Bizarre props and treasures of killers and monsters cover the dirty walls. Wax figures of JACK THE RIPPER stand gua before oil paintings by JOHN WAYNE GACY.
Alright let's get back to our monster  music marathon with this classic  called The Teddy Bear's Picnic.

Perched on a stool behind the counter sits CAPTAIN SPAULD a crusty looking old man in a filthy clown suit and smear make-up. The word LOVE is tattooed across his right knuck and HATE is tattooed across the left. He is reading the newspaper, crunching on crackers from a paper bag and halfheartedly listening to a small, nerdy m wearing coke bottle glasses named STUCKY. Stucky thumbs through a stack of autographed 8x10 photogr

(speaking through  voicebox in his throat) I... I got back a stack today. Some  nice shots. (holds up a picture  of June Wilkinson) See, a good topless June Wilkinson...  unfortunately she personalized it... (looking at the photo) to Stucky, love June.
Hmmmmm.
Shit, this ain't worth nothing now  that my name gotten all over it. I  was a fixin' on trading it to Jackie  Cobb.
The retard over at Molly's fruit  stand.
Yeah, he's all hot on her after he  found some of his dad's old nudie  books hidden in the basement. He  keeps 'em taped inside his school  workbook.
Spaulding brushes cracker crumbs off his paper and contin reading.
Fascinating.
That kid is one horny retard.
Christ, ain't they all. All them  retards wanna do is fuck and eat.
Well, yeah... I think that if you  knew him... I mean if you'd understand  his urges, shit the guy's like forty  or something.
Worse than a fucking rabid baboon.
Yeah, I guess, you know next to  wacking his weasel his other favorite  thing is twisting sharpened pencils  in the corner of his eyes.
What?
Yeah, doesn't hurt himself, just  spins it around next to his eyeball.
I'm sure that ain't the only place  he's sticking those pencils.
Naw, he don't do anything else with  'em, but he did get caught once with  a Planet of the Apes doll hanging  out his asshole.
(laughing) Goddamn.
Had to take him to the hospital. Kid  had Dr. Zaius stuck half way up his  butt, couldn't get it out.
I always loved that mute broad that  Chuck Heston was shacking up with.
Nova, yeah she looked pretty sweet.
Yeah, now there's the perfect woman.
Can I get some stamps off ya? (slapping down his  money) Did you fix the toilet yet?
Opens a drawer and tears off five stamps.
Yes, I did... so don't you go stuffin'  any goddamn paper towels down that  hole. I just snaked the shit out of  that thing.
Spaulding SLIDES the KEY attached to a cow skull across t counter. Stucky grabs it. Spaulding hangs on.
Ya hear me? You bust that crapper  and I'll beat your ass.
I hear ya.
He lets go of the key.
From a STRANGER'S POV we watch through the window, Stucky EXIT for the restroom. Sheriff Huston finishes pumping his gas, gets in his crui and drives off.
All clear. Let's go shopping.
Right.
From this POV we RACE across the highway towards the fron door of the MUSEUM. SLAM! We BURST through the door.

The moment of impact. BOOM. The door SMASHES open.   Spaulding's head JERKS up to see: a masked gunman, KARL,  wearing a LEATHER S+M MASK. Behind him stands a second gunman, RICH, wearing a rubber CAVEMAN MASK.
Mary fucking Moses. Get the fuck out  of here.
Hold it, clowney. Keep your paws  where I can see 'em.
Yeah, don't move or I'll blast a  hole the size of a Kansas City melon  through your ugly-ass Bozo face.
Spaulding obeys and raises his hands.
Go get that other asshole out of the  shitter and drag his ass back in  here.
Right.
Rich exits.
Miserable little cunts with guns. I  ought to jump right over this counter  and bash your fucking balls in.
Killer Karl steps up and puts his gun against Spaulding's face.
Alright Tippy, hand over the cash  box and I might leave your brains  inside your skull.
Spaulding smiles wide, his teeth are yellow and rotted.
Spaulding's foot kicks a red switch, triggering a silent  alarm.
That's what you bitches need. A  reality check courtesy of my boot in  your ass. That'll be a fucking cash  box you can cry to mamma about.

A silent RED LIGHT FLASHES. In the dim glow, we see RAVEL a large hunched figure, sitting on the edge of a bed. The figure is heavily bandaged. Ravelli reacts to the flashing light, he RISES and puts a huge mask over his head. He EXITS the room.
Stucky sits on the toilet pasting stamps on large yellow  envelopes. Killer Rich KICKS OPEN the stall, GRABS Stucky by the nec and PULLS him out.
Come on, fatboy!
We move around the outside of the building watching the s inside unfold. HEAVY BREATHING is heard. Rich DRAGS Stucky into the main room.
Karl grows increasingly HOSTILE, knocks a candy display o raises his gun over his head and fires into the ceiling.
(screaming) That's it. I'm gonna count to ten  and you're gonna hand over the cash  or I'm gonna splatter your grease  paint mug across the stateline...  one.
Fuck your mother.
Two.
Fuck your sister.
Come on, man. Just shoot him.
(recognizing Rich's  voice) Hey, I know you. We were in high  school together. Wood shop, right?  ...Richard Wick... right?
He looks nervously at Stucky.
Shut up, shut up, shut up!
Quiet down... three.
Fuck your grandmother.
Yeah, I remember Mr. Alacard the  shop teacher use'ta call you Little  Dick Wick. Hey, wasn't there a song  we made up to go with that?
(temper rising) Shut up!
(singing) Little Dick Wick, play with his prick  Don't his smell, just make you sick.

From Ravelli's POV we watch through the window, as everyb inside starts SHOUTING at each other. Suddenly, Rich SHOOTS Stucky. Stucky FALLS BACKWARDS agai the wall, screaming in pain. We move QUICKLY towards the entrance.

Suddenly... CRASH! Ravelli SMASHES through the front door knocking Karl to the ground. In the light we see that Rav is wearing an OVERSIZED CLOWN HEAD. In his hand is a  sledgehammer. Rich TURNS toward the COMMOTION. The Captain quickly WHIP OUT a GUN and FIRES. Rich falls dead. Ravelli lunges at Karl, smashing him over the head with t hammer. Ravelli's clown head comes loose and falls to the floor. We now see that Ravelli is a bald pitbull of a man with badly scarred skin that is painted white and red. Karl hits the floor and begins CONVULSING violently. Spaulding STEPS DOWN from behind the counter, puts his fo on Karl's throat and points his pistol at Karl's head.
And most of all... fuck you!
BOOM! Spaulding SHOOTS Karl in the head. The screen EXPLODES RED, then TURNS BLACK.
God damn it, that motherfucker got  blood all over my best clown suit.
Strange paintings of demons, monsters and bizarre creatur fade up and move across the screen.
We see a BILLBOARD painted on the side of an ABANDONED TR The sign reads GOD IS DEAD. We turn to face the road as a car drives by.
Alright then, out of all of Charlie's  chicks who do you think is the  hottest?

Fast food wrappers and road maps clutter the car's dashbo a swinging monkey head dangles from the rear-view mirror. Behind the wheel, the driver, BILL HUDLEY, 29, downs the  last sip of coffee before crumpling the paper cup and pla it among the other trash before him.
I guess if I had to choose I'd say...  mmmmmm... Sandra Good. She seemed  like a nice girl, I mean in a psycho  kind of way.
Beside him rides, JERRY GILMORE, 30, slumped down in his  seat, reading a magazine with a flashlight, feet hanging the window.
Really? Huh, I thought for sure you'd  say Lynette Fromme. She's got that  snooty vibe I know you dig.
Sqeaky! No way, she ain't that hot.
She's pretty cute.

Yeah but, she reminds me of this  chick that I remember from fourth  grade... called a... shit, what did  we call her? (thinks for second) Oh yeah, Patty Pee-pee Pants... when  ever she got called on by Miss  Chumski, this chick would piss in  her pants and start bawling.
(laughing) There always one kid with no bodily  controls. We had this dude, Jeff  Baxter, he was a puker. The fucker  would just sit there puke all over  himself.
Better than pissing... anyway so,  what's your choice?
If we're talking cute... like regular  cute, I'd say Leslie Van Houton, but  cute ain't hot.
Yeah, no shit.
As far a hot... goes I gotta go  with... Ruth Ann Moorehouse.
Oh yeah, I forgot about her. She was  pretty hot.
Fuck yeah, she is. I'd join a cult  to get some of that... and the best  part is she didn't try to kill the  President or nothing, so that baggage  ain't hanging around.
I thought she tried to murder a  witness for the prosecution.
I'll let it slide, she was only  seventeen.
Dude, talk about baggage, that ain't  no carry-on shit, that's some heavy  duty Samsonite shit.
Yeah, I guess... hot chicks are always  nuts.
Hot has got nothing to do with it.
A LONE FIGURE in a cheap skull mask and white robe stands hidden behind a billboard off to the side of the road. Bi car drives past.
(yawning) Hold on, I've heard this before...  but I can't remember the end.
So, the guy goes to Hell and the  devil says, "do you smoke?" The guy  say, "yeah"... the devil say, "great  cause Tuesday is cigar night, sweetest  Cuban cigars you ever had."
Shit, we really need to find some  gas.
(not listening) Then the devil asks, "do you drink?"  Guy says, "yeah"... devil say,  "wonderful, Wednesday is free drinks  night, best booze you ever had...  all made from the finest stuff."
Yeah.
Then the devil says, "are you gay?"  Guy says, "fuck no"... Devil says,  "Well then, I guess you're gonna  hate Thursdays."
Oh yeah, I remember now.
Yeah, no shit I just told ya. (looking at magazine) Hey, you think this place called  Alien Ed's UFO Welcoming Center is  still around? It says, "Where the  Fact is separated from the Fantasy."
I dunno... we'll ask around as we  get closer. Man, I really don't want  to run out of gas out here in the  middle of Petticoat Junction, man.

(sitting up) Don't panic yourself, way too much  caffeine guy... I see a sign. (reading the sign) Captain Spaulding's Museum of Madmen  and Monsters... cool. Also... fried  chicken and... gasoline... next exit.
Perfect.
I hope this place is cool. We could  use something interesting to liven  up chapter 12.
The car drives past. We turn and hold on the billboard. W see the happy smiling face of a young Captain Spaulding.
The car pulls up to one of the gas pumps. Bill and Jerry out. Inside we see Spaulding, now in army pants and a hun jacket, mopping the floor.
I'll pump the gas. Go inside and see  if it's worth thinking about.
(salutes) OK, Boss.
Jerry walks inside and immediately comes back out.
Holy crap. You gotta see this place.  It's awesome.
How awesome?
Really fucking awesome.
Wake up the chicks and bust out the  camera awesome?
Hell yeah.
Jerry sticks his head back inside the car.
Wakey, wakey, eggs and bakey.
A dark haired girl, DENISE WILLIS, 27, sleeps curled up u a blanket.
Come on, babe. Me and Bill found a  kick ass place.
She opens her eyes.
Huh?
Grab Mary and come inside.
Denise shakes a lump of jackets and sweaters lying next t her. She removes a sweater from the top of the pile to RE the face of MARY KNOWLES, 29.
Come on sleeping beauty, time to go  to work.
(half asleep) Sleeping.
Rise and shine.
(groggy) No please, let me sit this one out.
(removing the blanket) Let's go. You're the one who wanted  to be a photographer.
I resign.
Too late. You're in for life, let's  move it out Private Shutterbug.
(opening her eyes) Christ, I hope this isn't more crappy  folk art. It's so quaint... it's so  primal... it's so crap.
Aw, it ain't crap... it's... cute. (sarcastic) ...and really who are we to judge  the artistic merit of the tin-can  Mona Lisa?
Aw, shit... (exhales deeply) I gotta pee anyway.
Grainy super 8 footage shows us an OLD MAN standing in fr of a small shack. His name is Lewis Dover. The shack is  painted white and covered with SIMPLISTIC RELIGIOUS WRITI

I ain't no rich man, but I see the  truth. You do not have to go to Hell.  You are in Hell. This is Hell. All  American Hell. (holds up a gun) ...true heaven in my hands... I'm  gonna blow Satan back through the  door to Hell.
Surrounding the shack are strange sculptures of various h human/half-animal creations.

Spaulding swabs up the last remains of blood from the flo he drops the mop into a bucket filled with water and bloo Bill pays no attention, he is distracted by a strange obj in a glass case over the counter. In the case is a shrive up looking half human and half fish figure. It is the siz of a small child. A banner above reads: AQUALINA - THE MERMAID.
How long have you been running this  place?
How long is a piece of string? Too  God damn long, that's how long.
Spaulding slides the mop and bucket behind the counter.
No, really.
Shit, I don't remember exactly. I  took over for my Pa just after the  Duke nabbed the Oscar.
The Duke?
Yeah, my Pa wasn't right in the head  after that.
You mean John Wayne?
Hell, boy there some other Duke you  know about? (rolls up his sleeve  to reveal a John  Wayne tattoo) A great American.
Yeah, I was never that big of a  western fan. I like science fiction.
I figured that much. Why the fuck  you asking so many jackass questions  for?
You see me and my friends are writing  a book on offbeat roadside  attractions. You know all the crazy  shit you see when you drive cross  country.
I don't drive cross country.
But if you did.
I don't.
But suppose for a second you did.
(fake hick accent) Y'all find us country people real  funny like don't ya... well, God  damn pack up the mule and sling me  some grits, I'ze a gotta get me some  schooling.
No, no I think it's really  interesting.
Well fuck me Side Sally, who want to  read about all that horse shit anyway.
Jerry OVERHEARS Bill's and Spaulding's conversation and j in to help.
You'd be surprised. Would it be OK  if we took some pictures and included  this place in our book?
Hey, knock yourself silly.
You got some really rare stuff here... (pointing to Aqualina) ...dig your Feegee mermaid.

The restroom is gray, dingy, a single exposed light bulb  hangs from the ceiling. The peeling walls are plastered w newspaper clippings and faded photos. Mary is in the stall, sitting on the toilet, staring stra ahead at a poster of RHONDO HATTON, a B-MOVIE ACTOR that  suffered from acromegalia. Denise standing at a tiny sink, splashes water on her fac She looks at herself in the mirror.
(water running down  her face) I swear I've aged five years since  this trip started.
Tell me about it.
(takes a paper towel  and wipes her face) God, I hate falling asleep in the  afternoon. Now I'll be up all night... (stretches) ...ugh, my back is killing me.
Yeah, hey how far do you think we  are from your Dad's?
Mary flushes the toilet and exits the stall.
I don't know. Couple hours I think.  I've got to call him.
Mary washes her hands. Denise ties up her hair.
It will be nice to have a few days  off to regenerate. This trip is fun,  but it's starting to get brutal.
Yeah, I hit burn out mode back at  that old stripper lady's place.  Watching her dance around with those  ratty-looking animals was ridiculous.
I know, that was some crazy shit. I  never in a million years would have  believed it if I hadn't seen it.
A decent meal every once in a while  wouldn't hurt either, this road food  is crap.
If I never eat at another Waffle  House again, I can die a happy girl.
Scattered, smothered and covered.
Exactly... well, I guess a couple  more photos won't kill me.

Jerry knees over a box of magazines labeled TRUE CRIME $1 he flips through an issue, tosses it back. Bill leans against the wall next to him, sipping a hot cu of coffee. The girls return from the bathroom. Jerry jumps up with  excitement.
Great, you're back. Let's go. We  already paid for the tickets.
Tickets for what?
This isn't everything. Get ready for  this... there's a Museum of Murder  and Mayhem.
I don't want to see that.
How about if we skip it and just  hang out here. I can get some great  shots of this stuff.
Jerry PULLS Denise over and puts his arm around her.
Aw, come on. It will be fun.
Oh yeah, murder museum... sounds  fun.
Bill grabs Mary by the hand and kisses it.
(smiling) We'll need pictures of the inside  too.
Alright, alright. I know... I wanted  to be the photographer.
Bill and Mary kiss. Spaulding waits, unamused. He rolls his eyes.
Anytime this year, people. Alright  line your asses up in front of the  black door. The tour is about to  begin.
Spaulding disappears through a curtain behind the counter The kids wait. The black metal door CREAKS open. They enter the darkened room.
Darkness. A blue light comes on. Spaulding is standing on MOTORIZED PLATFORM. He begins the tour, speaking through small megaphone.

Ladies and gentlemen, you are about  to enter a world of darkness. A world  where life and death are meaningless  and pain is God. (pointing with a cane) To your left you see the infamous  Albert Fish.
A lifeless wax figure POPS forward with a loud metal CLAN Mary jumps back with fright.

Sadist, masochist, child killer and  most of all importantly cannibal.  Born in 1870, Mr. Fish enjoyed burning  himself with hot pokers, spankings  with nail-studded paddles and  embedding needles in his groin. On  the right, notice the X-ray...
...showing clearly 29 sewing needles  inserted in to his groin. Mr. Fish  was executed in 1936 at the age of  65.
Spaulding rolls backwards and continues the tour. CLOSE UP ON: a dummy face of a grizzly looking old man in hunting attire.
To your right. One of our most popular  crazies, the psycho of Plainfield,  Ed Gein.
Behind the figure of Gein hangs an inverted corpse of a s woman. Mary recoils in disgust.

Murderer, cannibal and momma's little  bitch boy. Mr. Gein found special  pleasure in playing with the dead  bodies of women, especially their  sexual organs. He was quite a handy  little dandy, fashioning lamp shades,  jewelry and human skin suits from  his victims. Mr. Gein was discovered  when the decapitated body of Bernice  Worden was found gutted like a deer,  hanging in his barn.
A wax figure of a young man in doctor's scrubs. He is cov in blood.
And now I would like to introduce a  local hero, S. Quentin Quale, a.k.a.  The Butcher Boy, a.k.a. Nurse Nellie  and most famously a.k.a. Dr. Satan.
Another wax figure, of a bloody corpse, JUMPS up.

Murderer, torturer and most of all  master surgeon. Mr. Quale an intern  at Willows State Mental Hospital,  nicknamed Weeping Willows for its  neverending cries of pain, took great  pleasure in control. Through primitive  brain surgery. Mr. Quale believed he  could create a race of superhumans  from the mentally ill, or so the  story goes. His terrifying experiments  continued until 1952.
Jerry stares fascinated.

At which time he was discovered and  turned over to authorities for  observation. Unfortunately, Mr. Quale  was abducted from his cell by members  of the victims' families. Vigilante  justice prevailed and Dr. Satan was  taken out and hanged. The next day  his body was found to be missing.  Some say he survived, rescued by his  loyal slaves, others say they hung  the wrong man... To this day no sign  of Dr. Satan has ever been discovered.  But who knows? Maybe he lives next  door to you.
KLUNK: A big metal door opens to the outside world.
Please exit through the door.
The kids exit. SLAM! The door shuts.

Denise leans against the glass walls of the phone booth. Various flyers are taped to the inside: free kittens, pho sex ads and a missing poster for a girl named KAREN MURPH A light rain begins to fall. Denise puts some change in the phone and dials a number.

The camera moves down a quaint quiet little street. We co to rest at a modest two-story house. The house is decorat for Halloween. Parents and their children roam from house to house, tric or treating. We hear the sound of a phone ringing.
A grey haired man sits at a small table eating a ham sand and drinking a beer. This is DONALD WILLIS, Denise's fath He stands up and walks to the phone hanging on the wall.
Hello... (brightens up) ...hey Denise... what, what's wrong,  did you break down?

No, nothing like that... yeah, we're  gonna be a little late. We stopped  for gas at this place called Capt.  Spaulding's outside of Ruggsville  and it turned into a whole thing, so  we're kind of behind schedule.
Oh yeah, yeah I've driven by that  place before. I seem to remember a  crabby old bastard in a crummy clown  suit running the place.

Yeah, well he's still here. I think  him and Jerry are fast becoming  buddies, you know Jerry... yeah,  he's gotta see everything... yeah, I  know... thinks there's some unsolved  mystery around every corner.

Well, don't take too long, the kids  are already knocking down the door  demanding their sugar fix... I know,  I know I forgot to mention that  Halloween falls on a school night,  so they're trick or treating  tonight... I got the joint decked  out this year, built a graveyard in  the front yard like when you were a  kid.
Hopefully I can move things along  here and make up the lost time by  speeding all the way home... yes,  Dad I'm kidding.
Well, just promise me you'll be  careful... alright, alright see ya  soon... good-bye.
Bill, Jerry and Mary wait for Denise.
I'm gonna go ask him.
Aw, come on Jerry. We've gotten all  we're gonna get out of this place  and its starting to rain.
Shit, it is only sprinkling and it's  worth the trouble. Hold on for two  seconds.
Jerry goes back inside.
Jerry knocks on the glass as he passes. Denise waves as h walks by.
Yeah so... OK, expect us more around  eleven or so. OK yeah, I will...  love you, too, bye.
She hangs up the phone, opens the doors and heads back to the car.
I know it's hard to understand, but  I really want to see this tree.
OK, alright I'll draw you a map, but  I still say it is a waste of time.
Great.
Through the window we see Jerry talking to Spaulding.   Spaulding draws a map, explaining as he draws.
Geez, he never gets tired does he.
Never. I swear to God he never sleeps,  he goes to bed after me, wakes up  before me. He's always working on  10.
Maybe he's a cyborg.
(wearily, sips his  coffee) I like sleep.
Here he comes.
Jerry comes bouncing out towards the car and jumps in. He is holding a map and a box of chicken.
We hit the jackpot! Let's roll, good  buddy. We got ourselves a convoy.
Huh?
Ugh, what's that smell?
Fried chicken. (holds up a drumstick) Anybody want some?
No one responds.
An OLD FARMER and his WIFE stare directly into the camera
I don't know where that skunk ape  sleeps. Maybe in the trees and all...  all I know is he eats squirrels to  survive and he had impure relations  with my wife.
That's true. He performed lurid acts  upon me and my person while my husband  Russell was a fix'n to our hound  Clarence.
If I see that thing again... I'm a  gonna kill that skunk ape.
(off screen) What does it look like?
It looked just like that chubby fella  from McHale's Navy... Ernie Borgnine.
Hold up the picture.
The wife holds up a pencil sketch of a Bigfoot like creat and a newspaper photo of Ernest Borgnine.
Bill's car moves past empty farmlands. A HEAVIER RAIN is falling.
Jerry directs Bill from Spaulding's hand-drawn map.
Keep straight on this road here.
How much further?
I'm not exactly sure... it looks  close. Did we pass an abandoned school  bus yet?
I don't know.
Mary and Denise sit bundled up in blankets.
Let's just skip it. It is probably  nothing anyway.
Aw Christ, Jerry. We can't see  anything now, it's too dark. Let's  forget it.
Come on, we need something like this.  It could be the real deal. It's too  far out of the way to come back to.
What's that?
Through the windshield we see a LONE FIGURE hitch-hiking the side of the road. It is a girl, BABY, 27, in a worn c hat and long fur coat. She is soaked to the bone.
It's a hitchhiker.
Way out here?
Well, don't even think about playing  the good samaritan, there's way too  many psychos wandering loose these  days.
(looking closer) It's a girl.
Hey, maybe she knows where this is?
(sarcastically) That seems likely.
Should we stop?
We can't leave her out here in the  rain... maybe we can just drop her  at the next rest area.
She looks like a freak.
Stick her in the front, if you want  to pick her up so bad. She's soaked.
She looks like she stinks.
(imitating Mary) She looks like she stinks.
(makes cat noises) Cat fight, cat fight.
Hardy har, har.
The car pulls over and Baby jumps in. The car moves off.
Once inside the car they see that the girl is a bit odd.
Whoa, thanks for stopping. I been  standing out there in that toad  strangling rain for like a hundred  million years.
Really, that's a long time.
Yeah, most people just whiz on by  like I was invisible or something...  or else they're creeps who wanna jam  their slimy hands down my pants and  twiddle my naughty-naughty.
Yikes.
Yeah, icky. This one guy stops and I  look in and he's got his thing out  waving it around like a drunk monkey.
Well, hitchhiking ain't the safest  way for a girl to travel.
Yeah, but it's fun.
Sounds like a magical trip through  the heartland.
Where ya headed?
Aw, I was going home to my Mamma's  house... yeah, I was out doing this  thing.
Where's that?
Couple more miles up this road.
Hey, you might know... (shows her the map) ...you know where this tree is at?  It's an old hanging tree from...
The Baby PERKS UP at the mention of the tree.
Yeah, I know where that is, it's  right by my house. It's Dr. Satan's  tree. I can show ya.
Really, wow, so it's really a real  thing.
Yeah, it's a tree. I used to play  there all the time. But, you can't  find it without me. Outsider can't  find no deadwood.
Deadwood, is that what it's called?  Cool, will you show us?
Maybe, maybe, maybe... hey, you know  what word I hate?
What?
Cone.
Huh... what cone?
Any cone, yeah... (looking out the window) I hate that word... sounds ugly, I  don't like crumple either.
I always hate saying the word cheese,  every time you get your picture  taken... smile, say cheese.
I know I hate Swiss cheese, the holes  make me nervous.
What about the tree?
Oh yeah, the tree.
This is crazy. She don't know nothing.
Baby turns her attention toward Mary.
Oh, I know. I'll show you where it's  at, sweetie. Aren't you just so cute  all bundled up like a cinnamon roll  of Christmas love.
Cool.
Which way?
